intro: Hedyotis purpurea f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered blushing geranium, is a variant of the species Hedyotis purpurea, characterized by its pale to white flowers as opposed to the typical purple ones. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and garden geraniums. The plant typically features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, delicate flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. This form is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various garden settings.
